Issues.Title: feat(bazel): expose explicit mapping from closure to devmode files
Issues.Body:
This feature is aimed at development tooling that has to translate
production build inputs into their devmode equivalent. The current
process involves guessing the devmode filename based on string
replace patterns. This allows consuming build actions to read the
known mappings instead.

This is a change in anticipation of an update to the general
Typescript build rules to consume this data.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

This is the helper method called by the TSC compilation logic to determine the output files for a given `ctx`. It only provides a list of outputs of various types with no information about how they relate to each other.

## What is the new behavior?

This adds a new field (`.transpilation_infos`) to the returned struct that allows to correlate a `closure_js` file to its corresponding `devmode_js` file.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(bazel): expose explicit mapping from closure to devmode files" (#36262)

Issues.Title: Case conversion pipes do not compose under strict TS checking
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/common` The issue seems to be related to an incoherence between the implementation and signature of `LowerCasePipe`, `TitleCasePipe`, and `UpperCasePipe`. https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/f8096d499324cf0961f092944bbaedd05364eea1/packages/common/src/pipes/case_conversion_pipes.ts#L32-L38 ### Is this a regression? No, this works as intended when either - templates are not typechecked - typescript is not strict Long ago Angular performed very limited checking of the templates, so it was much harder to get to this issue. ### Description The `lowercase` (/`titlecase`/`uppercase`) pipe is implemented to handle `null` values (which might come from an `async` or a `date` pipe), but its signature does not reflect this. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/ranma42/async-lowercase ## üî• Exception or Error 
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:1:4 - error TS2345: Argument of type 'string | null' is not assignable to parameter of type 'string'.
  Type 'null' is not assignable to type 'string'.

1 {{ v | date | lowercase }}
     ~~~~~~~~

  src/app/app.component.ts:7:16
    7   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.

Node: 12.16.0
OS: darwin x64

Issues.Title: Google Cloud Angular App Hosting 401 Error on Hosting
Issues.Body: I'm trying to deploy an angular app to a Google Cloud Storage bucket so that I can serve the app from there. The bucket has has public access and is named so that I can serve it as a custom website via CNAME (let's say test.example.com). The bucket is also configured to map the main page to index.html and the 404 handler to index.html. When loading https://test.example.com, most of the app loads fine, but any of the assets that are loaded via XHR (GET from /assets/) get a HTTP 401 error. There are no preflight requests. I've tried setting various permutations of CORS settings on the bucket, but nothing seems to help. I am getting this on loading on assets. `AuthenticationRequiredAuthentication required.` Can anyone help me out. We are using Google storage and Google DNS Hosting for this. Below link is for reference: https://html.developreference.com/article/10228923/401+error+with+Angular+app+deployed+to+Google+Cloud+Storage+with+CNAME%27d+DNS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Google Cloud Angular App Hosting 401 Error on Hosting" (#36257)

Issues.Title: fix(zone.js): UNPATCHED_EVENTS and PASSIVE_EVENTS should be string[] not boolean
Issues.Body:
`__zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS` and `__zone_symbol__PASSIVE_EVENTS` should be string[] type not boolean.
For example:
```
const config = window as ZoneGlobalConfigurations;
config.__zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS = ['scroll'];
config.__zone_symbol__PASSIVE_EVENTS = ['scroll'];
```

Issues.Title: When built with optimization compileModuleAndAllComponentsSync returns an empty list of component factories
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? This seems to be the behavoir since at least 9.0.1. ### Description Calling the `Compiler.compileModuleAndAllComponentsSync` method is supposed to return the component factories in addition to the module factory. However, when built with --prod, that list is empty. Looking over the compiled code, it looks like the `declarations` are completely removed from the module. Setting 'optimization' to false in angular.json solves the problem, but that means the code is no longer built for production. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction The problem can be observed with this minimal repo: https://github.com/AndreiVajnaII/lazy-load-ng-modules Just `npm install` and `ng serve`. Clicking on either "Load module 1" or "Load module 2" will call the `compileModuleAndAllComponentsSync` on a lazy loaded module and display a list of components it declares. However, if started with `ng serve --prod`, the list will be empty. ## üî• Exception or Error No error is given, the list of component factories is just empty ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.0.7
Node: 10.14.1
OS: win32 x64

Issues.Title: Angular 9 fails to refer the global type I declared in a custom type definition file
Issues.Body:
I've tried updating my angular project from Angular 8 to 9.

After the update, I entered `ng serve` to start up my app and it gave me these errors:

```javascript
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-container.component.ts:259:59 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ICoordinate'.

259     onContextClickLink({key, coord}: {key: string, coord: ICoordinate}): void {
                                                              ~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:52:27 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ITransactionDetailData'.

52             filter((data: ITransactionDetailData) => {
                             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:55:28 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'ITransactionDetailData'.

55         ).subscribe((data: ITransactionDetailData) => {
                              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/app/core/components/server-map/server-map-change-notification.service.ts:58:82 - error TS2304: Cannot find name 'INodeInfo'.

```

I suppose it's something to do with my custom definition file which occurs no error back in Angular 8. Anyway, I declared the types which I use across the app in `globals.d.ts.` under the `src` directory and let app the know it by referring it in `tsconfig.app.json` like:

```
"include": [
   "src/**/*.d.ts"
]
```

Again, there was no problem with this approach and I'm just wondering if something has changed internally which I didn't see from their migration guide. Any insight would be appreciated!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular 9 fails to refer the global type I declared in a custom type definition file" (#36251)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): correctly identify the package of targeted entry-points
Issues.Body:
In some scenarios, such as yarn workspaces, the node_modules
folder containing the target entry-point is not contained by
the original basePath passed to ngcc.

In this case, we were not computing the package path for  secondary
entry-points correctly, instead assuming that the path was the primary
entry-point.

I optimistically suggest that is PR will fix #35747,  #18637 and #36060. But I need to actually go through and check.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): correctly identify the package of targeted entry-points" (#36249)

Issues.Title: HttpClient/HttpRequest should support fetch API-specific redirect control
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/common/http

### Description
#27689 requests a Fetch-based backend for `HttpClient`.  The only response thus far has been "feel free to implement it yourself".  I don't actually care what backend is used.  I'm trying to replace my (fetch-based) back-end interactions with HttpClient so that I can use injected mocks for testing.  The problem is that I currently use several features that are not available in the existing API, like the `cache` and `redirect` options in the [Request](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Request) and the `redirected` property of [Response](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response/redirected).


### Describe the solution you'd like
I'd like to see first-class Angluar support for `fetch`-specific features.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I'm talking to back-end APIs that I have no control over.  I'm either going to have to a) stick with `fetch` and figure out how to test my code on my own, or b) switch to HttpClient and rewrite significant portions of my backend interactions to detect and handle redirects that I could have avoided using a simple `{redirect: "error"}` via native `fetch`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HttpClient/HttpRequest should support fetch API-specific redirect control" (#36246)

Issues.Body:

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Conditional Module imports (e.g. for development-only modules)

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core / ivy


### Description
View Engine allowed us to pass a module conditionally, which was useful as some modules should only be imported in development. Example:

```ts
@NgModule({
  imports: [
    process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? NgxsReduxDevtoolsPluginModule.forRoot({})  : undefined
  ]
})
```

Using Ivy, the above solution will fail when building with production target.
Running ng serve xxx --prod leads to these errors:
CLI will show lots of misguiding errors (telling me component xxx is not a known element).
Browser console will show "ASSERTION ERROR: Type passed in is not NgModuleType, it does not have '…µmod' property."

I thought Ivy might not like the undefined value, so I tried this as a workaround:

```ts
@NgModule()
export class NoopModule {}

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? NgxsReduxDevtoolsPluginModule.forRoot({})  : NoopModule 
  ]
})
```

... which lead to the same errors. 


### Describe the solution you'd like

Does Ivy support this by now, in way I don't know?
if not, I suggest to allow to pass undefined to module imports.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Conditional Module imports (e.g. for development only)" (#36243)

Issues.Title: [proposal] auto polyfilling support via `@babel/preset-env`
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)

<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

<!-- A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability... ‚úçÔ∏è-->

According to [Official Document](https://angular.io/guide/browser-support#polyfills), `polyfills` can only be included manually.

Sometimes we somehow use ESNext features like `Array.prototype.flatMap` but forget adding its polyfill into `polyfills.ts`, it accidentally breaks on some browsers.

### Describe the solution you'd like

<!-- If you have a solution in mind, please describe it. ‚úçÔ∏è-->

In @alauda, we are using [@alauda/custom-webpack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@alauda/custom-webpack) which pipes `babel-loader` after `@ngtools/webpack` in webpack config, so that we get _auto polyfilling_ successfully via `@babel/preset-env`.

So I'm suggesting to add `auto polyfilling` support into `@angular/cli`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

<!-- Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds? ‚úçÔ∏è-->

If we can build all `.ts` via `@ngtools/webpack` with targeting `esnext`, then we can use `babel` to compiling all ES syntaxes totally but are able to get types metadata still at the same time.

---

Related: We can add `esnext` entry support for APF.

https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/issues/1542

Issues.Title: externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update') doesn't respect order in chain() for migration
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update (schematics) - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Only tested with ^0.900.0 ### Description For given snippet: 
export function migrate(): Rule {
  return chain([
    externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update', {
      packages: ['@nguniversal/express-engine'],
      from: '8.0.0',
      to: '9.0.0',
    }),
    removeImportsInMainServerFile(),
  ]);
}
Both functions are invoked almost immediately, as provided in the screenshot below. If I understand correctly, chain() method containing externalSchematics with @schematics/update should respect the order and finish migration and then invoke another function in order. Tried approach with translating tree to observable in the second function, however, the outcome is the same. Looks like @schematics/update performs this asynchronously, causing the next functions to be invoked immediately. **I haven't noticed this behavior for other migrations or schematics from Angular collections (like creating an app, component, service etc.).** ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create simple migration containing externalSchematic('@schematics/update', 'update') for any given library. ## üî• Exception or Error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10993491/77640869-60811200-6f5b-11ea-9917-9ee18e2bb813.png) The red highlighted area is separate function that should be invoked after @schematics/update for the library has been completed. ## üåç Your Environment

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test

- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [X] update

- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Running `ng update @angular/cli --migrate-only tslint-version-6`

with a tslint config like this:
```
{
  "extends": [
    "tslint:recommended",
    "tslint-plugin-prettier",
    "tslint-config-prettier"
  ],
....
```

fails with 
```
 tslint configuration does not extend "tslint:recommended".
    Migration will terminate as some rules might conflict.
```

The following file implements the migration.
`https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/migrations/update-10/update-tslint.ts`

### [`v25.2.0`](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​2520)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/compare/v25.1.0...v25.2.0)

##### Features

-   `[jest-config]` Support ESM config files with `.js` extension ([#​9573](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9573)).
-   `[jest-runtime]` Override `module.createRequire` to return a Jest-compatible `require` function ([#​9469](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9469))
-   `[jest-haste-map]` [**BREAKING**] Remove `mapper` option ([#​9581](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9581))
-   `[*]` Support array of paths for `moduleNameMapper` aliases ([#​9465](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9465))
-   `[jest-reporters]` Adds ability to pass options to the istanbul-reporter through `coverageReporters` ([#​9572](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9572))
-   `[jest-runtime]` Require stack when a module cannot be resolved ([#​9681](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9681))
-   `[jest-transform]` `writeCacheFile` no longer calls `fsync` ([#​9695](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9695))

##### Fixes

-   `[expect]` Handle readonly properties correctly ([#​9575](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9575))
-   `[jest-cli]` Set `coverageProvider` correctly when provided in config ([#​9562](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9562))
-   `[jest-cli]` Allow specifying `.cjs` and `.mjs` config files by `--config` CLI option ([#​9578](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9578))
-   `[jest-cli]` Update yargs to fix CLI flag overriding ([#​9519](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9519))
-   `[jest-config]` Treat `setupFilesAfterEnv` like `setupFiles` when normalizing configs against presets ([#​9495](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9495))
-   `[jest-config]` Support `.mjs` config files on Windows as well ([#​9558](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9558))
-   `[jest-config]` Verify `rootDir` and all `roots` are directories ([#​9569](https://togithub.com/facebook/jest/pull/9569))

Issues.Title: bug(moment-adapter): "_rollupMoment__default is not defined"
Issues.Body:
(related with https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36248)

#### Reproduction

https://github.com/kaito3desuyo/angular-test

Steps to reproduce:
1. clone this repository
2. ``ng build --prod``
3. ``npm i -g http-server``
4. move root directory to ``dist/angular-test`` Folder
5. ``http-server``
6. open ``http://localhost:8080``

This issue only occurs with production builds.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Screen is displayed correctly


#### Actual Behavior

Screen goes blank with console error


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 x64 1909 18363.720

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v2.2.0`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​220)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v2.1.0...v2.2.0)

_2020-03-24_

##### Features

-   Add `renderDynamicImport` hook to rewrite dynamic import expressions ([#​3449](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3449))
-   Add information about dynamically imported modules to `this.getModuleInfo` ([#​3449](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3449))

##### Bug Fixes

-   Make file emission work with Uin8Array sources when using Rollup in the browser ([#​3452](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3452))
-   Fix types to allow watch to accept an array of configs ([#​3453](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3453))
-   Do not strip `.js` extensions from AMD imports when the import is a user-supplied replacement for a non-resolvable dynamic import target ([#​3453](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3453))

##### Pull Requests

-   [#​3449](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3449): Avoid the assumption of Buffer in browser envs ([@​lukastaegert](https://togithub.com/lukastaegert))
-   [#​3452](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3452): Avoid the assumption of Buffer in browser envs ([@​JoviDeCroock](https://togithub.com/JoviDeCroock))
-   [#​3453](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3453): fix types since watch accepts single or array config ([@​lukeed](https://togithub.com/lukeed))
-   [#​3456](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/pull/3456): fix SystemJS url in tutorial ([@​guybedford](https://togithub.com/guybedford))

</details>

Issues.Title: Core update schematic should update Typescript
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [X] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Update schematic should update TypeScript dependency too. Changelog for current Angular Core says that TypeScript was updated to version 3.8 but the schematic is not taking care of that.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14895873/77565535-205e5880-6ea3-11ea-9c4d-ba522740b1c3.png)


### Describe the solution you'd like
Angular core schematic should update Typescript for the required version, update `package.json` and notify in update log. I don't know if the same approach for RxJS update it's better or not, something like: `ng update typescript`.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only workaround is to update via `npm` but that could lead to some issues.

Issues.Title: NG Update 9.0  (please help)
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report

 
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [x ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


 


### Description

When using NG Update which we've been doing for many different solutions for quite a while now, we find these types of issues.

The Global and Dev environments will be out of sync.  Perhaps the Global will make it to 9 but often we have to handhold the Dev updates using NPM Install which even when specifying the exact same version and a component in Global, doesn't exactly match that version.  A good example was all Globals reached 9.0.1 but dev versions went to 9.0.2.

NG Update seems to bypass the Angular/CLI itself.  This forces another NPM install to sync up dev and global.   


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
[Create a new ASP.NET 31 Angular solution and try NG Update](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/client-side/spa/angular?view=aspnetcore-3.1&tabs=visual-studio)


 
 We are running on a Windows 10 environment with latest Node and NPM.  We have tried installing Angular/Cli@latest to start, we have just used the Angular/Cli around version 8....  Things do not go smooth.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NG Update 9.0  (please help)" (#17297)

Issues.Title: perf(material-experimental/mdc-chips): avoid checking the DOM on each change detection
Issues.Body: The MDC-based chip has a check called `_isBasicChip` which is called on each change detection, however its result won't change since it's based on the element's node name and a static attribute. These change resolve the value once and use a property instead.

Issues.Title: bug(MatCheckbox): Checkbox not disabled when form is disabled.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-g38766?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-com

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a form with a checkbox. Have it enabled in your form definition.
2. Disable form in ngOnInit. All fields become disabled and the disabled() method on the checkbox form element is true, but the checkbox behaves like it's still enabled.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Checkbox should be disabled like the rest of the fields.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Checkbox stays enabled.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9
- CDK/Material: 9
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, macOS

(reparacoesId.value[0].repairType | translateEnum: 'reparacao') : ('')}} (+{{reparacoesId.value.length - 1}}) {{reparo.repairType | translateEnum: 'reparacao'}} ``` With the code above I have the next resulte: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33934389/77694604-ad2b1400-6f80-11ea-89ff-19e477a28c17.png) Steps to reproduce: 1. Issues.Title: feat: report warning if duplicate theme styles are generated
Issues.Body:
As of the new density API, a theme by default includes density styles
for the zero density-scale. This means that the common pattern of using
the `angular-material-theme` pattern for secondary themes in a project
causes duplicated styles for density.

We want to detect this case and report a warning. Most of the time,
for these secondary themes, only the color styles are desired. If this
is not the case and a special case surfaces here, the warning can be
ignored, but it's still helpful reporting that same styles are generated
multiple times.

We can update these instances in the future with a `ng update` migration.

Blocked on #18915.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: report warning if duplicate theme styles are generated" (#18927)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nlepch Steps to reproduce:
  1. Hover over a collapsed header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  2. Expand the first panel
  3. Click in the first name field
  4. Hover over the expanded header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
  5. Tap tab twice to put keyboard focus on the 2nd panel header. Notice it does not use the color specified in CSS.
#### Expected Behavior Use the background color specified in CSS, for normal, hover, and focus states. #### Actual Behavior On hover over a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. On hover over an expanded header, the component is forcing its background to inherit from the panel itself. When keyboard focus is placed into a collapsed header, the component is forcing a specific background color. The only way to override this is seemingly to use **!important** or to override the generic mat-expansion-panel-header class. This appears to be a regression as it worked in some prior version of Angular Material (though I can't say exactly which). #### Environment - Angular: 9.0.7 - CDK/Material: 9.1.3 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System : Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-expansion-panel): Focus and hover backgrounds cannot be overridden in CSS" (#18920)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Custom Component Themes): Custom components themes need updated
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

I've been using Angular for over a year now and the page for custom component theming either needs removed or redone. It causes a lot more confusion that it has ever helped and the example is quite case specific and you simply can do a Google search to see there are absolutely _tons_ of confusion about this. Just look at [this](https://stackoverflow.com/a/58873540/3017217) answer on Stack Overflow, it's a prime example. It's not simple, not well documented, and Googling my problems usually are just leads to work around because of the lack of documentation. I'd like to help the documentation, but anyone hardly know how it works.


**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/guide/theming-your-components
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Custom Component Themes): Custom components themes need updated" (#18924)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag
Issues.Body:
Currently we resolve a drop list's scrollable parents inside `ngAfterViewInit`, but this might be too early if the element is being projected. These changes move the logic to the first time the user starts dragging which should guarantee that the DOM structure has settled.

Fixes #18737.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): defer resolving scrollable parents until first drag" (#18918)

Hello,

how call setOptions or setVisible for a marker ? (after init, display)

for exemple marker.title is callable but not marker.options or marker.setOptions:

(property) MapMarker.options: google.maps.MarkerOptions

Sample code:

> <map-marker #markerElem

>         marker.title = "changed title"; // works

Issues.Title: Changes for more convenient API to only generate color, density or typography styles

As discussed in the last meeting. We make the API for the theming bulk mixins such as `angular-material-color` more convenient, by allowing consumers to just pass a theme object.

Additionally, an initial draft for the documentation update has been included. Similarly, usages to the legacy theming color API have been replaced (also in the `ng-add` schematic)

Issues.Title: bug(Material Checkbox): focused styles works only for keyboard-focused checkboxes
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-zyqjwi

Steps to reproduce:
1. Place `Material Checkbox` after `Material Menu Trigger` button. (Maybe exist more scenarios)
2. `Tab` out from menu
 
#### Expected Behavior

`Material Checkbox` focused and has focused styles.

#### Actual Behavior

`Material Checkbox` focused but but does not have any focused styles.

Current behavior based on the next rule from `src/material/checkbox/checkbox.scss`:
```
.mat-checkbox.cdk-keyboard-focused & {
    opacity: 0.12;
}
``` 


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0-next.4
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): It does not matter
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): It does not matter

Issues.Title: refactor: remove unused sass variables in non-theme files
Issues.Body:
We have a couple of unused variables in Sass files which aren't
shipped to the consumers. This means that these variables can
be removed immediately without any deprecation period or breaking
change notice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: remove unused sass variables in non-theme files" (#18911)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs(material/bottom-sheet) clarify closeOnNavigation defaults to true" (#18909)

Issues.Title: fix(autocomplete): provide horizontal fallback positions
Issues.Body:
The positions for the autocomplete dropdown are set up assuming that the panel's width will match the input so they don't provide fallbacks along the x axis. Since we have a `panelWidth` input, the consumer might've overwritten the width to something different so we need to provide the fallbacks to ensure that the panel is always inside the viewport.

Fixes #18854.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(autocomplete): provide horizontal fallback positions" (#18906)

Issues.Title: fix(slider): not stopping drag when released outside of viewport
Issues.Body:
We're binding the slider events to the `document.body` which means that we won't pick up the ones that happen outside the viewport. These changes move the events to the `document`.

Fixes #18888.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(slider): not stopping drag when released outside of viewport" (#18905)

Issues.Title: Add density styles for non-experimental components without MDC equivalent
Issues.Body: **Note**: I wasn't sure how and whether we should do `expansion`. The height is hard-coded into an `@angular/animation` transition. We could/should revisit this in a follow-up? The problem I see here is that expansion actually provides inputs for specifying height. That doesn't play nicely with density.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add density styles for non-experimental components without MDC equivalent" (#18903)

Issues.Title: MAT-SELECT: On window resize some options from the mat-select options (mat-options) cannot be seen or selected
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-lr4cn8

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Build a mat-select with more than 6 options
2. Shrink the window to about 300 px height,
3. center the mat select in those 300 px, 
4. Click on the mat-select
5. Observe that the last/first elements are not in view even though you can scroll up to the last/first element. 

![sw-select-issue-first image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/365737/77429885-03625080-6de3-11ea-9d0b-0f5c1148e264.png)

![sw-select-issue-second-image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/365737/77429921-11b06c80-6de3-11ea-834e-11ec4482aa3f.png)

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

The expected behavior should be that i would be able to scroll to the last/first element and that the last element should be seen in the window.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

Even though i can scroll up to the last/first element they're not visible in the window


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.0
- CDK/Material: 9.1.3
- Browser(s): Google Chrome Version 80.0.3987.132 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MAT-SELECT: On window resize some options from the mat-select options (mat-options) cannot be seen or selected" (#18901)
